plot_confusion_matrix(normalize, title, cmap)[source]¶

This function prints and plots the confusion matrix. Normalization can be applied by setting normalize=True.

class flerken.framework.classitems.GradientPlotter(freq, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

static plot_gradients(named_parameters)[source]¶

Plots the gradients flowing through different layers in the net during training. Can be used for checking for possible gradient vanishing / exploding problems.

Usage: Plug this function in Trainer class after loss.backwards() as “plot_grad_flow(self.model.named_parameters())” to visualize the gradient flow

infer(*inputs)[source]¶
load_model(directory, strict_loading=True, from_checkpoint=False, **kwargs)[source]¶

Load model function which allows to load from a python dict, path to weights or checkpoint. If called enables framework.loaded_model = True

Parameters

  • directory (dict,str) – Loaded state dict or path to weights or checkpoint.

  • strict_loading (bool) – PyTorch strict_loading flag. Impose exact matching between loaded weights and model.

  • from_checkpoint (bool) – Forces function to interpret given weights as checkpoint dictionary.

Returns

None

property loss¶
property main_device¶
run_epoch(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Run the proper function depending on the context.

Parameters

  • args – passed arguments

  • kwargs – passed keywords

Returns

None

save_checkpoint(filename=None)[source]¶

Save checkpoint function. By default saves last epoch for training and best validation epoch. If there is no validation then best train epoch.

Parameters

filename (str) – Custom filename to save weights. Defautl is framework.checkpoint_name

Returns

None

save_gradients(absolute_iter)[source]¶
set_config()[source]¶
set_model_training(flag) → bool[source]¶

Trigger function to enable or disable model.train() and model.eval()

Parameters

flag (bool) – True –> activate model.train() mode. False –> activate model.eval() mode

Returns

bool

set_optim(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶
tensorboard_writer(loss, output, gt, absolute_iter, visualization)[source]¶
test()[source]¶

Analogous for train_epoch. :return: None

train(args)[source]¶
train_epoch(logger)[source]¶

Trains model for an epoch following an standard training. 1. Data loading 2. Data allocation 3. Model forward 4. Optimizer.zero_grad 5. output, loss and acc computation 7 Loss backward 8. In-Place gradient modification 9. Gradient healty plot 10. Databse update and checkpoint save :param logger: Logging instance to pass logs :return: None

validate_epoch()[source]¶

Analogous for train_epoch. :return: None

plot_grad_flow()[source]¶

Plots the gradients flowing through different layers in the net during training. Can be used for checking for possible gradient vanishing / exploding problems.

Usage: Plug this function in Trainer class after loss.backwards() as “plot_grad_flow(self.model.named_parameters())” to visualize the gradient flow
